title: Diamond Sword

steps.hint: We're going to make a sword out of diamond so first we will set up some variables to represent the colors **type** `sword = aquamarine`
We set up enough variable to represent the darker areas of the sword, we can use the darken function to alter the color of our existing sword color. **type** `darksword = darken(sword,40)`
We start by setting the `background` color to slategray`
Next we set our fill color to the variable we set up before **type** `color sword`
and set our stroke color to the darker version of our sword color **type** `stroke darksword,20`
Move the cursor to where the top of the blade will be **type** `move -20,-180`
Draw the blade of the sword **type** `rectangle 40,230`
It's already starting to take shape, let's create the handle **type** `move 10,250`
The grip isn't going to be made of diamond so set the `stroke` color to darkbrown
Draw a `rectangle` 20 by 100 for the grip
We're going to create the crossguard next **type** `move -70,-10`
Change the `stroke` color back to our darksword variable
We're going to use another color function: lighten to slightly change our diamond color **type** `color lighten(darksword,10)`
Notice how the lighten function altered the diamond color. **type** `move 80, -240`
Finally we're going to add a highlight detail to finish the sword **type** `color white`

completion_text: That sword looks exquisite, perfect for fighting your way out of some caves. Try changing the color on the first line, see how it changes all the other colors on the blade because of the variables.
